Sequence Information.Peptide Name: HlDFS1 (defensin; UCSS1a; 3S=S, Arg-rich; natural AMPs; hard ticks, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 76.3% similarity toAndroctonus defensin.  Molecular formula:  C177H295N71O43S6; Mol Wt  4311.144.    GRAVY= -0.52; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide:  4.27  kcal/mol.Activity: MIC90 recorded here: Active against Gram+ bacteria S. aureus CNCC63202 (MIC 50 uM); M. luteus CMCC28001 (MIC 10 uM); M. bovis (MIC 0.5 uM) and Gram- bacteria E. coli CMCC44103 (MIC 5 uM); B. burgdorferi 297-GFP(MIC 50 uM) as well as fungi C-albicans CAU0037 (MIC >50 uM).AMP Significance: Till 2016, B. burgdorferi is the only bacterial pathogen recognized to be responsible for lyme disease which was transmitted to human via the bite of infected tick. Updated 8/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Sun T, Pan W, Song Y, Zhang J, Wang J, Dai J.2017
Literature Information.Title: Functional characterization of two defensins, HlDFS1 and HlDFS2, from the hard tick Haemaphysalis longicornis
